question: Solubility product of <katex>$CaC_{2}O_{4}$</katex> at a given temperature in pure water is <katex>$4 \times 10^{-9} (mol \ L^{-1})^{2}$</katex>. Solubility of <katex>$CaC_{2}O_{4}$</katex> at the same temperature is:
explanation: For a 1:1 salt like <katex>$CaC_2O_4$</katex>, <katex>$K_{sp} = s^2$</katex>. Therefore, solubility <katex>$s = \sqrt{K_{sp}} = \sqrt{4 \times 10^{-9}} = 6.32 \times 10^{-5} \ mol \ L^{-1}$</katex>.
